intro: Pilosella sterrochaetia, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Pilosella sterrochaetia is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it adapts well to poor soil conditions.
